content.question: Core-periphery models are generally based on the idea that

choices.label: all world regions are equally well developed
levels of social and economic development are fairly uniform between core areas and peripheral areas
sharp spatial contrasts in social and economic development exist between economic heart­lands and outlying subordinate areas
the growth and prosperity of core countries has not been achieved at the expense of peripheral countries
the economic and social heart of a territory should be at its geographic center

content.answer: sharp spatial contrasts in social and economic development exist between economic heart­lands and outlying subordinate areas

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe geographic concepts, processes, models, and theories.
